articles.title: Argentine farmers back conservatives in election, hoping for freer markets
articles.description: In Argentina's grains fields and cattle ranches, farmers are hoping upcoming elections will bring political change and an end to years of economic uncertainty, ushering in freer markets with fewer currency controls and export limits.
articles.content:
[1/5] Cattle run in front of Juan Carlos Ardohain, 49, on a farm he rents in San Vicente, on the outskirts of Buenos Aires, Argentina August 10, 2023. REUTERS/Tomas Cuesta

articles.title: Argentina's markets keep wary eye on primary vote after 2019 crash
articles.description: Argentine traders are keeping a close eye on primary elections on Sunday, which will reveal the likely outcome of the Oct. 22 general ballot, with a major market crash after the same vote in 2019 still seared in their memories.
articles.content: A man wearing a face mask as a protective measure against the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) walks past the entrance of the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange, a day after midterm primary elections, in Buenos Aires, Argentina September 13, 2021. REUTERS/Agu... [3224 chars]

articles.title: Cirque du Soleil wants audiences to relive Messi's World Cup party
articles.description: A Cirque du Soleil production inspired by the life ​​and career of Argentine soccer legend Lionel Messi, will be staged in Buenos Aires in October, where Argentina's World Cup glory in Qatar still lives strong.
articles.content: [1/5] A woman attends the launching of the show Messi10 by Cirque du Soleil, inspired by the life, values ​​​​and career of Argentine soccer star Lionel Messi, in Buenos Aires, Argentina, in this photo released and distributed to Reuters on August 3,... [2139 chars]

articles.title: Factbox: Who are the candidates in Argentina's primary elections?
articles.description: Argentines will vote on Sunday in primary elections that will determine the final candidates for a presidential ballot in October and give a clear gauge on the likely final result as the country battles against a swirling economic crisis.
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, Aug 11 (Reuters) - Argentines will vote on Sunday in primary elections that will determine the final candidates for a presidential ballot in October and give a clear gauge on the likely final result as the country battles against a swir... [2836 chars]

articles.title: Voter anger, apathy hang over Argentina primary elections
articles.description: Argentina will hold primary elections on Sunday, a nationwide ballot that will act as a giant voter poll ahead of general elections in October, with many people angry or apathetic over triple-digit inflation and rising poverty.
articles.content: [1/4] Argentina's Economy Minister Sergio Massa departs after attending a meeting with International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva at the IMF headquarters in Washington, U.S., September 12, 2022. REUTERS/Evelyn Hockstein/File P... [3403 chars]

articles.title: Argentina's Rosario exchange gives upbeat 2023/34 soy, corn forecasts
articles.description: The South American country is one of the world's largest exporters of processed soybeans as well as a major corn and wheat supplier. Argentine farmers will start planting soybeans in October, and the Rosario exchange expects the planting area to surpass the previous season's by 6.3% with some 17 million hectares.
articles.content:
Argentina's Rosario grains exchange on Wednesday issued an upbeat forecast for the South American country's 2023/24 soybean and corn harvests.
The exchange predicted a 48 million metric ton harvest of soybeans, up from 20 million tons in the last sea... [1157 chars]

articles.title: Argentina election campaigns suspended after 11-year old killed in robbery
articles.description: Candidates for the national primary elections cancelled rallies as protests roiled city of Lanús, where attack took place
articles.content:
The death of an 11-year-old girl in a drive-by robbery caught on grainy security footage in Buenos Aires has shocked Argentina and prompted all major candidates to cancel their closing campaign rallies ahead of national primary elections on Sunday.

articles.title: Patagonia: Staff sought to teach Welsh at schools in Argentina
articles.description: The British Council is looking for three teachers to spend nine months teaching Welsh in Patagonia from March to December 2024. The project was set up in 1997 to help promote the Welsh language in the region.
articles.content:
Teaching staff are being sought to teach Welsh more than 7,000 miles away from Wales - in Argentina.
The British Council is looking to send three teachers to spend nine months teaching Welsh in three cities and towns in Patagonia.
